summary: The World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) is a pivotal non-governmental organisation established to promote, coordinate, and monitor the global fight against doping in sports. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, WADA's role is crucial for ensuring compliance with anti-doping regulations across member states. It develops and enforces the World Anti-Doping Code, which harmonises anti-doping policies and practices internationally. The EU supports WADA's initiatives to maintain fair competition and athlete integrity, reflecting its commitment to health and ethics in sports. WADA's collaboration with EU institutions enhances regulatory coherence and fosters a unified approach to combating doping.
